NMR spectroscopy is used for determining structure in which of the following materials?
artciles.description: NMR spectroscopy is used for determining structure in liquids. It is also used for determining the structure in soluble chemical compounds.

artciles.q: NMR is the study of absorption of __________ by nuclei in a magnetic field?
artciles.description: NMR is the study of absorption of radio frequency radiation by nuclei in a magnetic field. For a particular nucleus an NMR absorption spectrum may consist of one to several groups of absorption lines.

artciles.q: NMR spectrometer provides ____________ and _____________ method of determining structure in soluble chemical compounds.
artciles.description: NMR spectrometer provides accurate and non-destructive method of determining structure in soluble chemical compounds.

artciles.q:
NMR spectroscopy indicates the chemical nature of the __________ and spatial positions of
_______
artciles.description: NMR spectroscopy indicates the chemical nature of the nuclei and spatial positions of neighbouring nuclei.

artciles.q:
Which of the following statements most accurately describes the characteristics of 
1 H-NMR spectroscopy?
option: Labile protons such as -OH and -NH have no characteristic chemical shift.
The energy needed to flip energy states of the nuclei correspond to energies in the microwave region.
For a half-spin nuclei,there are 2 possible energy levels:lower occupied by spins aligned against and higher occupied by spins aligned with the magnetic field.
artciles.answer: Labile protons such as -OH and -NH have no characteristic chemical shift.
artciles.description: NMR spectroscopy uses non-ionizing EM radiation to flip the nuclei into the different energy states. More specifically, the nuclei absorb energies that are in the radio wave region, which is the region of lowest energy and longest wavelength.

artciles.q:
Which of the following statements most accurately describes the chemical shift in 
1H-NMR?
option: Electronegative atoms enhance the shielding of hydrogens and cause downfield shifts, and the extent of this shift is proportional to the electronegativity of the atom and proximity to the hydrogen.
The applied magnetic field causes the p electrons of aromatic compounds to circulate and produce a secondary magnetic field that causes the deshielding of the aromatic hydrogens.
Aryl, carbonyl, and allylic groups are electron-donating by induction and cause a downfield shift of a hydrogen on an adjacent carbon.
artciles.answer: The applied magnetic field causes the p electrons of aromatic compounds to circulate and produce a secondary magnetic field that causes the deshielding of the aromatic hydrogens.
